AbstractPipe.description:
Base class for Pipe.
 A Pipe represents an action to take in a Pipeline. This class is ment to be extended
 for defining steps or actions to take to complete a request. 
 The contract is that a pipe is created (by the digester), setName(String) is called and
 other setters are called, and then IPipe.configure() is called, optionally
 throwing a ConfigurationException. 
 As much as possible, class instantiating should take place in the
 IPipe.configure() method.
 The object remains alive while the framework is running. When the pipe is to be run,
 the doPipe method is activated.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
controls whether Pipe is included in configuration. When set false or set to something else as "true", (even set to the empty string), the Pipe is not included in the configuration
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input
when set and the regular input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
when set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also  ReceiverBase.setElementToMove(java.lang.String))
if set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)
if set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: "{sessionKey:" + elementToMoveSessionKey + "}"
(only used when elementToMove is set) name of the session key under which the character data is stored
like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. "adapter;pipeline;pipe")
when set true namespaces (and prefixes) in the compacted message are removed
controls namespace-awareness of possible XML parsing in descender-classes
Timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.
when set to true a record is written to the security log when the pipe has finished successfully
(only used when writeToSecLog=true) comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
when set, the value in AppConstants is overwritten (for this pipe only)

Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. Note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

Base64Pipe.description: Pipe that performs base64 encoding and decoding.
properties: If true and decoding, result is returned as a string, otherwise as a byte array. If true and encoding, input is read as a string, otherwise as a byte array.
character encoding to be used to encode or decode message to or from string. (only used when convert2String=true)

(only used when direction=encode) Each line of encoded data will be at most of the given length (rounded down to nearest multiple of 4). If lineLength <= 0, then the output will not be divided into lines
(only used when direction=encode) defines separator between lines. Special values: auto: platform default, dos: CRLF, unix: LF

BytesOutputPipe.description: Output bytes as specified by the input XML.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
controls namespace-awareness of possible XML parsing in descender-classes
name of forward returned upon completion

ChecksumPipe.description: Pipe to calculate checksum on input.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
type of checksum to be calculated. Must be one of MD5, SHA, CRC32, Adler32
character encoding to be used to encode message before calculating checksum
when set true, the input is assumed to be a filename; otherwise the input itself is used in the calculations
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
files that match this pattern will be deleted. Parameters of the pipe are applied to this pattern. If this attribute is not set, the input of the pipe is interpreted as the file to be removed
when true, files  in subdirectories will be deleted, too
time in milliseconds that must have passed at least before a file will be deleted
when true, empty subdirectories will be deleted, too
filter of files to delete. If not set and a directory is specified, all files in the directory are interpreted to be deleted
Filter of files to be excluded for deletion
minimal age of file in milliseconds, to avoid deleting a file while it is still being written

CommandSender.description:
Deprecated. 
Please replace with nl.nn.adapterframework.senders.CommandSender


public class CommandSender
extends CommandSender
Sender that executes either its input or a fixed line, with all parametervalues appended, as a command.

CompareIntegerPipe.description:
Pipe that compares the integer values of two session variables.
 Used to in combination with IncreaseIntegerPipe to contstruct loops.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
controls whether Pipe is included in configuration. When set false or set to something else as "true", (even set to the empty string), the Pipe is not included in the configuration
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
controls namespace-awareness of possible XML parsing in descender-classes
reference to one of the session variables to be compared
reference to the other session variables to be compared

CompareStringPipe.description: Pipe that compares lexicographically two strings.
properties: reference to one of the session variables to be compared
reference to the other session variables to be compared
when set true the string values to compare are considered to be xml strings and before the actual compare both xml strings are transformed to a canonical form

CompressPipe.description: Pipe to zip or unzip a message or file.
properties: Flag indicates whether the message is the content or the path to a file with the contents. For multiple files use ';' as delimiter
Flag indicates whether the result must be written to the message or to a file (filename = message)
Required if result is a file, the directory in which to store the result file
Required if result is a file, the pattern for the result filename
The pattern for the zipentry name in case a zipfile is read or written
If true the pipe compresses, otherwise it decompress
If true result is returned as a string, otherwise as a byte array

When set to gz, the GZIP format is used. When set to another value, the ZIP format is used. If not set and direction is compress, the resultIsContent specifies the output format used (resultIsContent="true" -> GZIP format, resultIsContent="false" -> ZIP format) If not set and direction is decompress, the messageIsContent specifies the output format used (messageIsContent="true" -> GZIP format, messageIsContent="false" -> ZIP format)

CounterSwitchPipe.description:
Selects an exitState, based on the number of received messages by this pipe.
 
 The exitState is the difference (subtraction) between the divisor and
 the remainder of [number of received messages] modulus divisor.
 This will always be an integer between 1 and divisor, inclusive.

properties: content type of the servlet response

CredentialCheckingPipe.description: Pipe to check the the CredentialFactory (for testing only).

CrlPipe.description:
Pipe that reads a CRL from an input stream and transforms it to an XML.
 The steam is closed after reading.
 
 Example configuration:
 
                <pipe
                        name="Read issuer"
                        className="nl.nn.adapterframework.pipes.FilePipe"
                        actions="read"
                        fileName="dir/issuer.cer"
                        preserveInput="true"
                        outputType="stream"
                        storeResultInSessionKey="issuer"
                        >
                        
                
                <pipe
                        name="Read CRL"
                        className="nl.nn.adapterframework.pipes.FilePipe"
                        actions="read"
                        fileName="dir/CRL.crl"
                        outputType="stream"
                        >
                        
                
                <pipe
                        name="Transform CRL"
                        className="nl.nn.adapterframework.pipes.CrlPipe"
                        issuerSessionKey="issuer"
                        >
properties: name of the sessionKey that holds a stream to the certificate of the issuer who signed the CRL. The steam is closed after reading

DelayPipe.description:
Pipe that sleeps for a specified time, which defaults to 5000 msecs.
 Usefull for testing purposes.
properties: the time the thread will be put to sleep

DigesterPipe.description:
Converts an XML string (input) to a set of java objects using the
 digester.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
name of file that containts the rules for xml parsing

DomainTransformerPipe.description:
Pipe that performs domain transforming on the basis of a database table.

 Every string which equals "%![DT{label,valueIn,type}]" will be replaced by valueOut. 
 
 The field type, which is optional, indicates the format of valueIn. Currently the following types are supported:
 
 
   string (default): the methode setString() is used
   number: the method setDouble() is used
properties: the name of the table that contains the mapping
the name of the column labels are stored in
the name of the column source values are stored in
the name of the column destination values are stored in
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion

EscapePipe.description: Pipe that performs translations between special characters and their xml equivalents.
properties: when set true special characters in substringStart and substringEnd are first translated to their xml equivalents

EtagHandlerPipe.description: Pipe to manage RESTFUL etag caching

ExceptionPipe.description: Pipe that throws an exception, based on the input message.
properties: when true, a PipeRunException is thrown. Otherwise the output is only logged as an error (and no rollback is performed).

ExchangeMailListener.description:
Implementation of a IPullingListener that enables a
 GenericReceiver to look in a folder
 for received mails. When a mail is found, it is moved to an output folder (or
 it's deleted), so that it isn't found more then once. A xml string with
 information about the mail is passed to the pipeline.
properties: username used in authentication to exchange mail server
mail address (also used for auto discovery)
(only used when mailAddress is empty) url of the service
if set, the mail is streamed to a file (eml)

ExecutePipe.description:
Deprecated. 
please use CommandSender


public class ExecutePipe
extends FixedForwardPipe
Executes a command.
properties: The command to execute (if command and commandSessionKey are empty, the command is taken from the input of the pipe)
The session key that holds the command to execute

FileLineIteratorPipe.description: Sends a message to a Sender for each line of the file that the input message refers to.
properties: Directory in which the transformed file(s) is stored
Directory to which the inputfile is moved in case an error occurs

FilenameSwitch.description: Selects an exitState, based on the last (filename) part of the path that is the input.
properties: when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
convert the result to lowercase, before searching for a corresponding forward

FixedForwardPipe.description:
Provides a base-class for a Pipe that always has the same forward.
 Ancestor classes should call super.configure() in their configure()-methods.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call AbstractPipe.doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input
when set and the regular input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
controls namespace-awareness of possible XML parsing in descender-classes
name of forward returned upon completion
when set, this pipe is skipped
when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifParam equals ifValue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

FixedResult.description:
Provides an example of a pipe. It may return the contents of a file
 (in the classpath) when fileName or fileNameSessionKey is specified, otherwise the
 input of returnString is returned.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
name of the file containing the resultmessage
name of the session key containing the file name of the file containing the result message
Should values between ${ and } be resolved from the PipeLineSession (search order: 1) system properties 2) pipeLineSession variables 3) application properties)
string to search for in the returned message
string that will replace each of the strings found in the returned message
stylesheet to apply to the output message
when set true, the lookup of the file will be done at runtime instead of at configuration time
when set true, any parameter is used for replacements but with name-of-parameter and not ${name-of-parameter}

FixedResultSender.description:
Deprecated. 
This sender has been moved to the senders-package.

ForEachChildElementPipe.description:
Sends a message to a Sender for each child element of the input XML.
 Input can be a String containing XML, a filename (set processFile true), an InputStream or a Reader.
properties: expression used to determine the set of elements iterated over, i.e. the set of child elements
when set true, the input is assumed to be the name of a file to be processed. Otherwise, the input itself is transformed
characterset used for reading file or inputstream, only used when processFile is true, or the input is of type InputStream
when set true XSLT processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used for elementXPathExpression, otherwise XSLT processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan)

GenericMessageSendingPipe.description:
Plain extension to MessageSendingPipe that can be used directly in configurations.
 Only extension is that the setters for listener and sender have been made public, and can therefore
 be set from the configuration file.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call MessageSendingPipe.doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
when set, the Pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the XML well-formedness of the result is checked
when set, besides the XML well-formedness the root element of the result is checked to be equal to the value set
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
name of forward returned upon completion
result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. "receiver timed out").
Indicates wether the server uses the correlationID or the messageID in the correlationID field of the reply
xpath expression to extract audit trail from message
xpath expression to extract correlationID from message

GetFromSession.description:
Gets the contents of the pipeLineSession by a key specified by
 sessionKey.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
name of the key in the PipeLineSession to retrieve the output message from

GetLtpaTokenPipe.description: Returns the LTPA token associated with the session.
properties: name of forward returned upon completion
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one

GetPrincipalPipe.description: Returns the name of the user executing the request.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one

IfMultipart.description:
Selects an exitState, based on the content-type of a httpServletRequest
 object as input.

IncreaseIntegerPipe.description:
Pipe that increases the integer values of a session variable.
 Used to in combination with CompareIntegerPipe to contstruct loops.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified, then the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
controls namespace-awareness of possible XML parsing in descender-classes
name of forward returned upon completion
reference to the session variable whose value is to be increased

IsolatedServiceCaller.description: Helper class for IbisLocalSender that wraps around ServiceDispatcher to make calls to a local Ibis adapter in a separate thread.

IsUserInRolePipe.description:
Pipe that checks if the calling user has a specified role. 
 Uses the PipeLineSessions methods.
properties: name of forward returned if user has role
name of forward returned if user is not allowed to assume the specified role

IsXmlIfPipe.description:
Selects an exitState, based on if the input is a XML string.
 
 The input is a XML string if it, after removing leading white-space characters, starts with '<'.
properties: return elseForward when input is empty (or thenForward)

IteratingPipe.description: Abstract base class to sends a message to a Sender for each item returned by a configurable iterator.

blockSize: 0 (one line at a time, no prefix of suffix)

properties: when set true, the calls for all items are done in parallel (a new thread is started for each call). When collectResults set true, this pipe will wait for all calls to finish before results are collected and pipe result is returned
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the XML well-formedness of the result is checked
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
name of forward returned upon completion
result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. "receiver timed out").
Indicates wether the server uses the correlationID or the messageID in the correlationID field of the reply
xpath expression to extract audit trail from message
xpath expression to extract correlationID from message
stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it
alternatively: XPath-expression to create stylesheet from
namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
either 'text' or 'xml'. Only valid for xpathExpression
force the transformer generated from the XPath-expression to omit the xml declaration
when true ignore any exception thrown by executing sender
postprocess each partial result, to remove the xml-declaration, as this is not allowed inside an xml-document
controls whether all the results of each iteration will be collected in one result message. If set false, only a small summary is returned
controls multiline behaviour. when set to a value greater than 0, it specifies the number of rows send in a block to the senderDOT
0 (one line at a time, no prefix of suffix)
When blockSize > 0, this string is inserted at the start of the set of lines.
When blockSize > 0, this string is inserted at the end of the set of lines.

When startPosition >= 0, this field contains the start position of the key in the current record (first character is 0); all sequenced lines with the same key are put in one block and send to the sender
When endPosition >= startPosition, this field contains the end position of the key in the current record
this string is inserted at the start of each line
this string is inserted at the end of each line
key of session variable to store number of item processed.
when true the input is added to the result in an input element
when true duplicate input elements are removed

JmsCommunicator.description:
Deprecated. 
please use GenericMessageSendingPipe with JmsSender (and if necessary JmsListener), that has same functionality


public class JmsCommunicator
extends MessageSendingPipe
Sends a message (the PipeInput) to a Topic or Queue, 
  and receives a message from another Topic or Queue after the input message has been sent.

 If a listener is specified it waits for a reply with
 the correct correlationID.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call MessageSendingPipe.doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. "receiver timed out").
name of the queue the receiving party should reply to, as included in the message that is sent

Json2XmlValidator.description: Pipe that validates the XML or JSON input message against a XML-Schema and returns either XML or JSON.

ignoreUnknownNamespaces: true when schema or noNamespaceSchemaLocation is used, false otherwise

properties: maximum number of threads that may call XmlValidator.doPipe(Object, IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
The filename of the schema on the classpath. See doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)
A URI reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace. See doc on the method.
Pairs of URI references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). See doc on the method.
Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunException on a validation error (if not, a forward with name "failure" should be defined.
if set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in
like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive
name of the root element. Or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)
when set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated
characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

the namespace of the SOAP Envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP Message the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator2 is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP Message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value
ignore namespaces in the input message which are unknown
true when schema or noNamespaceSchemaLocation is used, false otherwise
when set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)
when set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)
when set true, the namespace from schemaLocation is added to the schema document as targetNamespace
comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document
when set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path
comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document
when set true, the number for caching validators in AppConstants is ignored and NO caching is done (for this validator only)
when set, the value in AppConstants is overwritten (for this validator only)
when true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in XML
when true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml
when true, assume that JSON contains/must contain a root element
Ony for JSON input: namespace of the resulting XML. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the Schema
default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'
when true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'
session key to retrieve outputFormat from.

JsonPipe.description: Perform an JSON to XML transformation
properties: Direction of the transformation. Either json2xml or xml2json
Version of the jsonpipe. Either 1 or 2.
when true, and direction is json2xml, it wraps a root element around the converted message

LogSender.description:
Deprecated. 
Please replace with nl.nn.adapterframework.senders.LogSender


public class LogSender
extends LogSender
Sender that just logs its message.
properties: level on which messages are logged
category under which messages are logged

subject: subject field of the message
message: message itself. If absent, the complete input message is assumed to be the message
messageType: message MIME type (at this moment only available are text/plain and text/html - default: text/plain)
messageBase64: indicates whether the message content is base64 encoded (default: false)

properties: name of the host by which the messages are to be send
alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to smtpHost
password of userid on the smtpHost
value of the From: header if not specified in message itself
value of the Subject: header if not specified in message itself
message itself. If absent, the complete input message is assumed to be the message
message MIME type (at this moment only available are text/plain and text/html - default: text/plain)
indicates whether the message content is base64 encoded (default: false)
name of forward returned upon completion
name of the host by which the messages are to be send
password of userid on the smtpHost
value of the From: header if not specified in message itself
value of the Subject: header if not specified in message itself

MessageSendingPipe.description:
Sends a message using a sender and optionally receives a reply from the same sender, or 
 from a listenerDOT
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
when set, the Pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
when set true, the XML well-formedness of the result is checked
when set, besides the XML well-formedness the root element of the result is checked to be equal to the value set
when set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one
name of forward returned upon completion
result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. "receiver timed out").
Indicates wether the server uses the correlationID or the messageID in the correlationID field of the reply. This requirers the sender to have set the correlationID at the time of sending.
xpath expression to extract audit trail from message
namespace defintions for auditTrailXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
Key of a PipeLineSession-variable. If specified, the value of the PipeLineSession variable is used as audit trail (instead of the default "no audit trail")
xpath expression to extract correlationID from message
namespace defintions for correlationIDXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
stylesheet to extract correlationID from message
Key of a PipeLineSession-variable. Is specified, the value of the PipeLineSession variable is used as input for the XpathExpression or StyleSheet, instead of the current input message
Next to common usage in AbstractPipe, also strings in the error/logstore are masked

(only used when hideRegex is not empty and only applies to error/logstore) either all or firstHalf. When firstHalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked
xpath expression to extract label from message
namespace defintions for labelXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
stylesheet to extract label from message
when not empty, a TimeOutException is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)
when not empty, a PipeRunException is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)
the number of times a processing attempt is retried after a timeout or an exception is caught or after a incorrect reply is received (see also retryXPath)

The starting number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made. Each next retry this interval is doubled with a upper limit of retryMaxInterval
The maximum number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made
xpath expression evaluated on each technical successful reply. Retry is done if condition returns true
namespace defintions for retryXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
when set true, the input of a pipe is used to extract audit trail, correlationID and label (instead of the wrapped input)
if set, the result is first base64 decoded and then streamed to the HttpServletResponse object
when the previous call was a timeout, the maximum time (in seconds) after this timeout to presume the current call is also a timeout. A value of -1 indicates to never presume timeouts
any attribute of the sender instantiated by descendant classes

MoveFilePipe.description: Pipe for moving files to another directory.
properties: base directory where files are moved from
name of the file to move (if not specified, the input for this pipe is assumed to be the name of the file
session key that contains the name of the filter to use (only used if wildcard is not set)
name of the destination file (if not specified, the name of the file to move is taken)
session key that contains the name of the file to use (only used if move2file is not set)
number of copies held of a file with the same name. Backup files have a dot and a number suffixed to their name. If set to 0, no backups will be kept.
when set true, the destination file will be deleted if it already exists. When set false and numberOfBackups set to 0, a counter is added to the destination filename ('basename_###.ext')
maximum number of attempts before throwing an exception
when set true and the destination file already exists, the content of the file to move is written to the end of the destination file. This implies overwrite=false
when set to true, the directory from which a file is moved is deleted when it contains no other files
when set to true, the directory to move to is created if it does not exist
string which is inserted at the start of the destination file
string which is inserted at the end of the destination file (and replaces the extension if present)
when true, numberOfBackups is set to 0 and the destination file already exists a PipeRunException is thrown (instead of adding a counter to the destination filename)
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
Whether the SecureRandom algorithm is to be used (slower)
The number of lowercase characters in the generated password
The number of uppercase characters in the generated password
The number of digits in the generated password
The number of sign characters in the generated password

PasswordHashPipe.description:
Hash a password or validate a password against a hash using PasswordHash.java
 from https://crackstation.net/hashing-security.htm.
 Input of the pipe is expected to be the password. In case hashSessionKey
 isn't used a hash of the password is returned. In case hashSessionKey is used
 it is validated against the hash in the session key which will determine
 the forward to be used (success or failure).
properties: name of sessionKey that holds the hash which will be used to validate the password (input of the pipe)

PostboxRetrieverPipe.description:
Retrieves a message using an IPostboxlistenerDOT 
 
 Note that most listeners allow you to specify a timeout. The timeout has the following
 meaning:
  
 <0 = no wait
 0 = block until message available
 >= 0 maximum wait in milliseconds
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
result when no object is on postbox
name of forward returned upon completion
any attribute of the listener instantiated by descendant classes

PostboxSenderPipe.description:
Deprecated. 
please use plain GenericMessageSendingPipe, that has same functionality (since 4.2d)


public class PostboxSenderPipe
extends GenericMessageSendingPipe
Sends a message using a sender and optionally receives a reply from the same sender, or from a listenerDOT
properties: maximum number of threads that may call MessageSendingPipe.doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
any attribute of the sender instantiated by descendant classes

PutInSession.description:
Puts the input in the PipeLineSession, under the key specified by
 sessionKey.
properties: name of forward returned upon completion
name of the key in the PipeLineSession to store the input in
The value to store the in the PipeLineSession. If not set, the input of the pipe is stored

PutParametersInSession.description: Puts each parameter value in the PipeLineSession, under the key specified by the parameter name.

PutSystemDateInSession.description: Puts the system date/time under a key in the pipeLineSession.

timeZone: the default time zone for the JVM

properties: key of session variable to store result in
the time zone to use for the formatter
the default time zone for the JVM
If true, the date/time returned will always be December 17, 2001, 09:30:47 (for testing purposes only). It is overridden by the value of the pipeLineSession key stub4testtool.fixeddate when it exists
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion

RemoveFromSession.description:
Removes a key specified by sessionKey
 from the pipeLineSession.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
name of the key in the PipeLineSession to remove. If this key is empty the input message is interpretted as key. For multiple keys use ',' as delimiter
when set true, the result of this pipe will be the same as the input. Otherwise the content of the removed key is returned (and '[null]' when the key is not found)

ReplacerPipe.description: Replaces all occurrences of one string with another.
properties: string that will replace each of the strings found
Sets the string the representation in find and replace of the line separator
Replace all non XML chars (not in the character range as specified by the XML specification) with replaceNonXmlChar
character that will replace each non valid XML character (empty character is also possible)
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion

RhinoPipe.description:
Rhino JavaScript Runtime Factory Pipe.
 
 This pipe takes all input and pushes it into javascript runtime.
 The invoke method is called to initialize the runtime
 Afterward the results are evaluated.

any: Any parameters defined on the pipe will be Concatenated into one string and added to input

properties: when set true or set to something else then "true", (even set to the empty string), the debugging is not active
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
name of the file containing the Java-script Functions as base input
The name of the function in the java-script library to run
The arguments to run the function in the java-script library to run
Any parameters defined on the pipe will be Concatenated into one string and added to input

SizePipe.description: Returns the number of bytes or characters in the input.

SkipPipe.description: Skip a number of bytes or characters from the input.
properties: number of bytes (for byte array input) or characters (for String input) to skip. An empty byte array or String is returned when skip is larger then the length of the input
if length>=0 only these number of bytes (for byte array input) or characters (for String input) is returned.

StreamLineIteratorPipe.description: Sends a message to a Sender for each line of its input, that must be an InputStream.
properties: when set to false, the inputstream is not closed after it has been used
when set, each line has to end with this string. If the line doesn't end with this string next lines are added (including line separators) until the total line ends with the given string

StreamPipe.description: Stream an input stream to an output stream.
properties: name of forward returned upon completion
(only used for parameter httpRequest) when true the first part is not put in a session key but returned to the pipeline (as the result of this pipe)
(only used when extractFirstStringPart=true) the session key to put the xml in with info about the stored parts

(only used for parameter httpRequest) when true parts are checked for antivirus scan returncode. These antivirus scan parts have been added by another application (so the antivirus scan is NOT performed in this pipe). For each file part an antivirus scan part have been added by this other application (directly after this file part)
(only used for parameter httpRequest and when checkAntiVirus=true) name of antivirus scan parts
(only used for parameter httpRequest and when checkAntiVirus=true) message of antivirus scan parts which indicates the antivirus scan passed

(only used for parameter httpRequest and when checkAntiVirus=true) when true and the antiVirusFailed forward is specified and the antivirus scan did not pass, a SOAP Fault is returned instead of only a plain error message

Text2XmlPipe.description: Pipe for converting text to or from xml.
properties: the xml tag to encapsulate the text in
controls whether a declation is included above the Xml text
controls whether the lines of the input are places in separated <line> tags
Replace all non XML chars (not in the character range as specified by the XML specification) with the inverted question mark (0x00BF)
controls whether the text to encapsulate should be put in a CDATA section

TimeoutGuardPipe.description: Extension to FixedForwardPipe for interrupting processing when timeout is exceeded.

timeout: When a parameter with name timeout is present, it is used instead of the timeout specified by the attribute

properties: when true, a PipeRunException is thrown. Otherwise the output is only logged as an error (and returned in a XML string with 'error' tags)
timeout in seconds of obtaining a result
When a parameter with name timeout is present, it is used instead of the timeout specified by the attribute
maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
name of forward returned upon completion
directory to extract the archive to
SessionKey with a directory value to extract the archive to
when true, file is automatically deleted upon normal JVM termination
if set false, only a small summary is returned
if set false, a suffix is added to the original filename to be sure it is unique
if set true, subdirectories in the zip file are supported

UploadFilePipe.description: Uploads a zip file (inputstream in a sessionKey) and unzips it to a directory.
properties: name of the key in the PipeLineSession which contains the inputstream
base directory where files are unzipped to
the session key that contains the base directory where files are unzipped to

UUIDGeneratorPipe.description: Pipe that generates an UUID (Universally Unique Identifier).

WsdlGeneratorPipe.description: Generate WSDL of parent or specified adapter.
properties: either parent (adapter of pipeline which contains this pipe) or input (name of adapter specified by input of pipe)

WsdlXmlValidator.description:
XmlValidator that will read the XSD's to use from a WSDL. As it extends the
 SoapValidator is will also add the SOAP envelope XSD.
properties: all attributes available on SoapValidator can be used
the WSDL to read the XSD's from

see schemaLocation attribute on XmlValidator except that the schema locations are referring to schema's in the WSDL, schema1 refers to the first, schema2 refers to the second and so on. If not set, all schema's are derived from the WSDL
Pairs of URI references which will be added to the WSDL
creates schemaLocation attribute based on the WSDL and replaces the namespace of the SOAP Body element

XmlBuilderPipe.description: Pipe for converting special characters to their xml equivalents.

XmlFileElementIteratorPipe.description: Sends a message to a Sender for each element in the XML file that the input message refers to.
properties: the name of the element to iterate over (alternatively: elementChain)
the name of the element to iterate over, preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. "adapter;pipeline;pipe")

XmlIf.description: Selects an exitState, based on the content of a sessionkey.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
name of the key in the PipeLineSession to retrieve the input-message from. If not set, the current input message of the Pipe is taken. N.B. same as getInputFromSessionKey
XPath expression to be applied to the input-message. If not set, no transformation is done
a string to compare the result of the xpathExpression (or the input-message itself) to. If not specified, a non-empty result leads to the 'then'-forward, an empty result to 'else'-forward

XmlParamSwitch.description:
Deprecated. 
please use plain XmlSwitch, that now supports parameters too (since 4.2d)

XmlSwitch.description:
Selects an exitState, based on either the content of the input message, by means
 of a XSLT-stylesheet, the content of a session variable or, by default, by returning the name of the root-element.

serviceSelectionStylesheetFilename: a stylesheet that returns the name of the root-element

properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
stylesheet may return a String representing the forward to look up
a stylesheet that returns the name of the root-element

XPath-expression that returns a String representing the forward to look up. It's possible to refer to a parameter (which e.g. contains a value from a sessionKey) by using the parameter name prefixed with $
namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
name of the key in the PipeLineSession to retrieve the input message from. (N.B. same as getInputFromSessionKey)
Forward returned when the content, on which the switch is performed, is empty. If emptyForwardName is not specified, notFoundForwardName is used.
Forward returned when the pipename derived from the stylesheet could not be found.
when set true XSLT processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used, otherwise XSLT processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan)

XmlValidator.description: Pipe that validates the input message against a XML-Schema.

ignoreUnknownNamespaces: true when schema or noNamespaceSchemaLocation is used, false otherwise

properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(Object, IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
The filename of the schema on the classpath. See doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)
A URI reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace. See doc on the method.
Pairs of URI references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). See doc on the method.
Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunException on a validation error (if not, a forward with name "failure" should be defined.
if set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in
like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive
name of the root element. Or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)
when set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated
characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

the namespace of the SOAP Envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP Message the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using SoapValidator is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP Message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value
ignore namespaces in the input message which are unknown
true when schema or noNamespaceSchemaLocation is used, false otherwise
when set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)
when set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)
when set true, the namespace from schemaLocation is added to the schema document as targetNamespace
comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document
when set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path
comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document
when set true, the number for caching validators in AppConstants is ignored and NO caching is done (for this validator only)
when set, the value in AppConstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

XmlWellFormedChecker.description:
Pipe that checks the well-formedness of the input message.
 If root is given then this is also checked.

XPathPipe.description:
Deprecated. 
Please use XsltPipe, that has the same functionality


public class XPathPipe
extends XsltPipe

properties: name of the file (resource) on the classpath to read the xquery from
name of the file on the file system to read the xquery from

XsltParamPipe.description:
Deprecated. 
please use plain XsltPipe, that now supports parameters too(since 4.2d)

XsltPipe.description: Perform an XSLT transformation with a specified stylesheet.
properties: maximum number of threads that may call doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession) simultaneously
if durationThreshold >=0 and the duration (in milliseconds) of the message processing exceeded the value specified the message is logged informatory
when set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input
when set, the result is stored under this session key
stylesheet to apply to the input message
XPath-expression to apply to the input message. It's possible to refer to a parameter (which e.g. contains a value from a sessionKey) by using the parameter name prefixed with $
namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
either 'text' or 'xml'. Only valid for xpathExpression
force the transformer generated from the XPath-expression to omit the xml declaration
when set true empty tags in the output are removed
when set true, result is pretty-printed. (only used when skipEmptyTags="true")
when set true namespaces (and prefixes) in the input message are removed
when set true XSLT processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used, otherwise XSLT processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan)

DirectoryListener.description:
File listener that looks in a directory for files 
 according to a wildcard and a excludeWildcard.  
 When a file is found, it is moved to an outputdirectory, so that it isn't found more then once.  
 The name of the moved file is passed to the pipeline.
properties: Filter of files to look for in inputDirectory
Filter of files to be excluded when looking in inputDirectory
when true, the file modification time is used in addition to the filename to determine if a file has been seen before

When set a list of files in xml format (<files><file>/file/name</file><file>/another/file/name</file></files>) is passed to the pipleline instead of 1 file name when the specified amount of files is present in the input directory. When set to -1 the list of files is passed to the pipleline whenever one of more files are present.

When set along with fileList a list of files is passed to the pipleline when the specified amount of ms has passed since the first file for a new list of files was found even if the amount of files specified by fileList isn't present in the input directory yet
Directory where files are stored while being processed
Pattern for the name using the MessageFormat.format method. Params: 0=inputfilename, 1=inputfile extension, 2=unique uuid, 3=current date
Directory where files are stored after being processed
number of copies held of a file with the same name. Backup files have a dot and a number suffixed to their name. If set to 0, no backups will be kept.
when set true, the destination file will be deleted if it already exists
when set true, the file processed will deleted after being processed, and not stored
minimal age of file in milliseconds, to avoid receiving a file while it is still being written
pass the filename without the outputDirectory to the pipeline
when set to true, the directory to look for files is created if it does not exist
Waittime to wait between polling. N.B. not used anymore. Please use pollInterval on the Receiver instead
maximum number of move attempts before throwing an exception. N.B. not used anymore. Please use maxRetries on the Receiver instead
time waited after unsuccesful try. N.B. not used anymore.
when set to true, every file in the directory is passed in a random order

FileRecordListener.description:
File listener that looks in a directory for files according to a wildcard. When a file is
 found, it is read in a String object and parsed to records. 
 After reading the file, the file is renamed and moved to a directory.
properties: name of the listener as known to the adapter.
set the directory name to look in for files.
the wildcard to look for files in the specified directory, e.g. "*.inp"
set the time to delay when no records are to be processed and this class has to look for the arrival of a new file
the directory to store processed files in
when set, the name of the read file is stored under this session key

GenericReceiver.description:
Plain extension of ReceiverBase that can be used directly in configurations.
 Only extension is that the setters for its three worker-objects are public, and can therefore
 be set from the configuration file.
 For configuration options, see ReceiverBase.

JavaListener.description: The JavaListener listens to java requests.
properties: name of the listener as known to the adapter. An IbisLocalSender refers to this name in its javaListener-attribute.
when set false, the request is executed asynchronously. This implies isolated=true. N.B. Be aware that there is no limit on the number of threads generated
Should the JavaListener throw a ListenerException when it occurs or return an error message
when true, the WSDL of the service provided by this listener is available for download

MessageWrapper.description: Wrapper for messages that are not serializable.

PullingListenerContainer.description: Container that provides threads to exectue pulling listeners.

ReceiverBase.description: This Receiver may be used as a base-class for developing receivers.

classname: name of the class, mostly a class that extends this class

properties: name of the class, mostly a class that extends this class
name of the class, mostly a class that extends this class
name of the receiver as known to the adapter
when set false or set to something else as "true", (even set to the empty string), the receiver is not included in the configuration
the number of threads that may execute a pipeline concurrently (only for pulling listeners)
the number of threads that are activily polling for messages concurrently. '0' means 'limited only by numThreads' (only for pulling listeners)
one of 'continue' or 'close'. Controls the behaviour of the receiver when it encounters an error sending a reply or receives an exception asynchronously
comma separated list of keys of session variables that should be returned to caller, for correct results as well as for erronous results. (Only for listeners that support it, like JavaListener)
Timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to receive and process a message.
The maximum delivery count after which to stop processing the message. When -1 the delivery count is ignored

The number of times a processing attempt is retried after an exception is caught or rollback is experienced (only applicable for transacted receivers). If maxRetries < 0 the number of attempts is infinite
(only used when checkForDuplicates=true) Either 'CORRELATIONID' or 'MESSAGEID'. Indicates whether the messageID or the correlationID is used for checking presence in the message log
The number of seconds waited after an unsuccesful poll attempt before another poll attempt is made. (only for polling listeners, not for e.g. IFSA, JMS, WebService or JavaListeners)
xpath expression to extract correlationID from message
namespace defintions for correlationIDXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
stylesheet to extract correlationID from message

Regular expression to mask strings in the error/logstore. Everything character between to strings in this expression will be replaced by a '*'that fits the expression is replaced. For Example, the regular expression (?<=<Party>).*?(?=</Party>) will replace every character between keys and
(only used when hideRegex is not empty) either all or firstHalf. When firstHalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked
xpath expression to extract label from message
namespace defintions for labelXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions
stylesheet to extract label from message
comma separated list of keys of session variables which are available when the PipeLineSession is created and of which the value will not be shown in the log (replaced by asterisks)
if set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)
if set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: "{sessionKey:" + elementToMoveSessionKey + "}"
(only used when elementToMove is set) name of the session key under which the character data is stored
like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. "adapter;pipeline;pipe")
when set true namespaces (and prefixes) in the compacted message are removed
when set true XSLT processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used for extracting correlationID and label, otherwise XSLT processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan)

ServiceDispatcher.description:
Singleton class that knows about the ServiceListeners that are active.
 
 This class is to be used as a facade for different services that implement
 the ServiceClient interface.
 This class is exposed as a webservice, to be able to provide a single point
 of entry to all adapters that have a ServiceListener as a IReceiver.

ServiceDispatcher_ServiceProxy.description:
WebService proxy class that can be used in applications that need to communciate with
 the IBIS Adapterframework via a webservice.

ServiceDispatcherBean.description:
Wrapper around the ServiceDispatcher to work around
 the problem that the ServiceDispatcher is a singleton
 and cannot be instantiated.
 N.B. This class is used by the deprecated old-style webservices, using ServiceDispatcher_ServiceProxy.
 Please consider using a call using serviceNamespaceURI instead.
